definition: prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough

sentences.english: But Grandpa did not want to work at Soba restaurant anymore.
sentences.chinese: 不过老爷爷不想再在荞麦面馆工作了。

sentences.english: A lord regarded as immature or insignificant.
sentences.chinese: 这位老爷爷很小的时候就入了村塾。

sentences.english: The old man was wandering on the streets selling sugarcoated haws on sticks.
sentences.chinese: 卖冰糖葫芦的老爷爷走街串巷地叫卖。

sentences.english: Do you remember the old man we both know near the town?
sentences.chinese: 你是否还记得我们都认识的在镇上的那个老爷爷？

sentences.english: A grandfather's preserved corpse lies in his family home years after his death.
sentences.chinese: 一个老爷爷的尸体在死后仍然保存在家中多年。

sentences.english: Grandpa leaned slowly toward Grandma and gave her a lingering kiss on her wrinkled cheek.
sentences.chinese: 老爷爷慢慢斜过身来在她的腮帮上给他一个长吻。

sentences.english: Grandpa had walked a long way to find them.
sentences.chinese: 老爷爷跑了许多路才找到他们。

sentences.english: Grandpa, do you really call her grandma?
sentences.chinese: 老爷爷，您真的叫她姑婆？

sentences.english: This old man entered a village school when he was very young.
sentences.chinese: 这位老爷爷很小的时候就入了村塾。

sentences.english: The naughty boy mimed his old grandfather.
sentences.chinese: 这个淘气的孩子模仿他的老爷爷。

sentences.english: Old gramps will even act as your assistant.
sentences.chinese: 老爷爷将会作为你的助手打理农场。

sentences.english: The school clinic to find the kind of traditional Chinese medicine, a kind of grandfather in Zuotang.
sentences.chinese: 就找那种中医校诊所，一个老爷爷在坐堂的那种。

sentences.english: Each morning, Grandpa was up early sitting at the kitchen table reading from his old worn-out Bible.
sentences.chinese: 老爷爷每天都起得很早，在餐桌旁看圣经。

sentences.english: Granddad fetched up some anecdotes of the old days.
sentences.chinese: 老爷爷回忆起旧时的一些逸事。

sentences.english: The grandfather takes great pride in caring for the pigs.
sentences.chinese: 老爷爷负责喂猪，感到很自豪。

definition: (coll.) father's father's mother/paternal great-grandmother/respectful form of address for an old woman
grandpa (polite form of address for old man)
(informal) grandma (paternal grandmother)/(respectful) mistress of the house/CL:位[wei4]/(coll.) boobies/breasts
(coll.) father's older brother/uncle/term of respect for older man
maternal aunt/step-mother/childcare worker/nursemaid/woman of similar age to one's parents (term of address used by child)/CL:個|个[ge4]
eldest of father's younger brothers/uncle (term used to address a man about the age of one's father)
old man or woman/the elderly/one's aged parents or grandparents
father's elder brother's wife/aunt (affectionate term for an elderly woman)
polite term for old woman or man
